content.question: Charlesâ€™s law states that if the pressure of a dry gas is held constant, then the volume <math alttext="V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the gas and its temperature <math alttext="uppercase T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, measured in degrees Kelvin, satisfy the relationship <math alttext="V equals, c times uppercase T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a constant. Which of the following best describes the relationship between the rate of change, with respect to time <math alttext="lowercase t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, of the volume and the rate of change, with respect to time <math alttext="lowercase t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, of the temperature?

choices.label: <math alttext="the derivative of V, with respect to lowercase t, equals, uppercase T times the derivative of c, with respect to lowercase t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>T</mi><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>c</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of V, with respect to lowercase t, equals, c times the derivative of uppercase T, with respect to lowercase t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of V, with respect to uppercase T, equals c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1 equals, c times the derivative of uppercase T, with respect to V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the derivative of V, with respect to lowercase t, equals, c times the derivative of uppercase T, with respect to lowercase t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
